Please state your full name for the record.
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: Wayne Elliot Oliver.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Mr. Oliver, have you ever been deposed before?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  All right.  Let me give you some instructions generally speaking. Today's deposition shouldn't take all that long.  I'll try to keep it under half an hour, if not less.  It goes easier if you just listen to the question, and wait until I'm done before you answer.  It's tougher if you interrupt me because then we've got a record that doesn't come out well.  Do you understand that?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: I understand.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  The court reporter, who's seated immediately to your left, is going to take down all of my questions and all of your answers, so it's important that you speak up, and I think you're already off to a good start, and make sure she understands what you say.  Okay?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: I'm clear.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: We all do some things informally that don't come out on the record well, so using that expression -- awful expression "uh-huh" or nodding your head, or using your hands as a gesture, doesn't come out on the record because the court reporter can't interpret that.  So try to keep all of your answers verbal.  Okay?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: Okay.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: As I said, I'm going to ask you questions.  You're going to give answers. At the end of the deposition, the court reporter will prepare a deposition transcript that will contain all of the questions and all of the answers.  Do you understand that?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: I understand that.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And do you understand that that is a transcript that can be used at trial?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: I understand that.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: If you don't understand a question, I ask that you just tell me, and I'll rephrase it to make it clear for you. Okay?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: Okay.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: If your attorney should object for whatever reason, don't answer.  If you're in the middle of an answer, stop answering, and wait until she and I work out that objection.  Okay?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: Okay.

text: Good. All right.  Where do you live, sir?

text: 5425 Oxford Avenue, Philadelphia, PA  19124.

speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: Myself.

speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: It's been for about six years.
speaker: THE WITNESS

speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: I'm a security consultant.

speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: LDS, Incorporated.

text: Self-employed.

text: Okay.

text: Yes.

text: Of my vehicle.

text: And of the other vehicle involved in this accident.

text: Both vehicles?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: Yes.

speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: No.  Other than today.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: In other words, are you okay proceeding?  Have you gotten sufficient instructions from your attorney so you can go forward?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: I'm okay proceeding.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  You understand that your testimony today is under oath?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: I do.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you understand that that's the same oath you would get in a court of law?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: I do.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Yes.

speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: It was.

text: I don't recall that.

speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: I don't recall.

speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: No.

speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: Yes.

speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: I don't exactly recall.

text: Do you remember the month or the year?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: August.  I don't recall the year.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Do you recognize my client who's seated next to me?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: I do.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you recall that you were in a collision with her?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: I do.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you remember what kind of vehicle she was operating?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: Chevy, Chevrolet, large SUV.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  And you had a Jeep?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: That's correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Tell me what happened.
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: What happened?  That day of the accident, I was traveling on Washington Lane and stopped at a red light, red traffic light.  She was -- your client was in front of me.  The light was red.  Once the light turned green during the stormy conditions of the -- stormy conditions; it was raining hard.  Her vehicle began pulling off, pulled to the right and pulled back to the left and just, like, immediately stopped -- slammed on her brakes.  And then the front of my vehicle hit her vehicle.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How long had it been raining?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: That entire morning.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  And, so, did the collision occur before noon?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: I don't recall, but it was daylight.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: It was daylight?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What was visibility like?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: Due to the heavy rain conditions, poor.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Did you ever find out why she applied her brakes?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what did you find out?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: From your client, after our conversation, she stated that she felt sorry for someone running for the bus on the very close corner, and she basically said she felt sorry for them and immediately stopped.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you see that person before the impact occurred?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: I did not.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you see them after the impact occurred?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: I did not.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you have any reason not to believe my client?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: I held no judgement.

text: Okay.  Now, you told me earlier that you stopped for a red light at Washington Lane.  Was there an intersecting street?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: Yes, there was.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what was the intersecting street?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: I believe it to be Stenton Avenue.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  How many lanes on Washington Lane?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: One in each direction.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How about Stenton?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: The same.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you have any recollection as to how long you waited for the light to turn green?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: I do not.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: One of the instructions I didn't give you was that if you're able to estimate, you can certainly give me an estimate.  If you can't estimate, it's an acceptable answer for you to tell me you don't know.  Okay?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I'm not referring to the previous question.  It's just a general instruction.
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: Okay.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Anytime I ask you something, if you can give me an estimate, great.  If you can't, just let me know.  Okay?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: I can answer?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Yes.
speaker: MS. KOSCIELNIAK

text: Do you have any recollection as to how long you waited for the light to turn from red to green?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: 10, 15 seconds.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Now, you also testified that once the light turned green, you observed my client pull her vehicle to the right?

text: That's correct.

speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: Appreciation?  I'm not sure of your --

text: Did you know why she did that?

text: I did not know.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: It was my intention to go past her, and then -- yes, it was my intention.

text: I understand it was your intention.  Did you try to pass her on the left?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: I remained in my lane and continued forward.

text: So you didn't try to pass her?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: I remained in my lane and continued to proceed forward.

text: Well, that's not an answer to my question, so let me ask it again.  Did you try to pass her on the left?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: It was my intention to pass her.

text: I know what your intention was. I'm asking, did you try?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: I couldn't.  Because of the actions of the vehicle in front of me, I could not pass her.

text: Are you telling me you couldn't pass her because she pulled back into the lane?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: That's exactly what I'm telling you.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  Can you give me an estimate as to the speed she was traveling when you observed her pull to the right?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: Approximately 5 to 10 miles per hour --

text: And how about when she pulled back to the left?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: Accelerated out, probably 10 to 15.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So she was traveling about 5 to 10 miles per hour when she pulled to the right, and about 10 to 15 miles per hour when she pulled back to the left, correct?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: About 10 to 15 when she pulled back out, accelerated out.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: To the left?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: To the left.

speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: Location?

text: Yes.
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: On Washington Lane.

text: At the -- at the beginning of the intersection.

text: So when the front of your vehicle struck the rear of her vehicle, how far was my client in the intersection?

text: About -- somewhere between a quarter of a car length to maybe, partially, half of a car length.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  So tell me about your actions.  You told me about her actions. In other words, you told me that she moved to the right and then moved back to the left.  When she moved to the right, did you move your vehicle?

text: My vehicle remained in the operating lane going forward.

text: Yes.

text: I braked hard.

text: I braked or attempted to brake hard once she moved back in the operating lane.

text: Okay.  So if I understand what you're saying, when my client moved to the right, you began to move forward, correct?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: Correct.

text: And when she came back to the left, because you were already moving forward, you applied your brakes, correct?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: That's correct.

text: Okay.  What was the distance between the front of your vehicle and the rear of her vehicle when my client moved to the right?

speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: And what was your speed when you observed my client move to the right?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: And what was your speed when my client moved back to the left?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: About 10 miles per hour.

text: And what was your speed when you hit her?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: About 10 miles per hour.

text: And if I understand what you're telling me, the front of your Jeep struck the rear of my client's Chevy, correct?

text: That's correct.

text: Yes.

text: What she said to me was, "Are you okay?"  I asked the same of her, "Are you okay?"  She said to me that she was sorry; there was a man running for the bus.  She felt -- she just saw this man was running for a bus, and she just felt bad for him because of the rain.  She wanted him to get to his bus, some bus.

text: She said she was fine.

text: Okay.  Did you talk about calling the police?
speaker: MR. GOODSTADT

text: Okay.
